basic.name: は / が (wa/ga)
basic.explanation: Indicates the subject of the sentence
basic.example: 私は学生です (Watashi wa gakusei desu) - I am a student

basic.name: を (wo)
basic.explanation: Indicates the object of the sentence
basic.example: リンゴを食べます (Ringo wo tabemasu) - I eat an apple

basic.name: です (desu)
basic.explanation: Formal copula used to indicate the state or quality of a noun
basic.example: 彼は優しいです (Kare wa yasashii desu) - He is kind

basic.name: ます (masu)
basic.explanation: Formal verb ending used to indicate present tense
basic.example: 私は勉強します (Watashi wa benkyou shimasu) - I study

basic.name: だ (da)
basic.explanation: Informal copula used to indicate the state or quality of a noun
basic.example: 彼は優しいだ (Kare wa yasashii da) - He is kind

basic.name: る (ru)
basic.explanation: Informal verb ending used to indicate present tense
basic.example: 私は勉強する (Watashi wa benkyou suru) - I study

particles.name: に (ni)
particles.explanation: Indicates the destination or location of an action
particles.example: 学校に行きます (Gakkou ni ikimasu) - I go to school

particles.name: へ (he)
particles.explanation: Indicates the direction of an action
particles.example: 公園へ行きます (Kouen he ikimasu) - I go to the park

particles.name: で (de)
particles.explanation: Indicates the location where an action takes place
particles.example: レストランで食べます (Resutoran de tabemasu) - I eat at a restaurant

particles.name: から (kara)
particles.explanation: Indicates the starting point of an action
particles.example: 家から出ます (Ie kara demasu) - I leave from home

particles.name: まで (made)
particles.explanation: Indicates the end point of an action
particles.example: 駅まで行きます (Eki made ikimasu) - I go to the station

particles.name: と (to)
particles.explanation: Indicates the means or method of an action
particles.example: 電話で話します (Denwa de hanashimasu) - I talk on the phone

particles.name: は (wa)
particles.explanation: Indicates the topic of a sentence
particles.example: 私は日本語が好きです (Watashi wa Nihongo ga suki desu) - I like Japanese

particles.name: も (mo)
particles.explanation: Indicates the addition or inclusion of something
particles.example: りんごも食べます (Ringo mo tabemasu) - I eat apples too

verb tenses.name: ている (teiru)
verb tenses.explanation: Indicates the progressive form of a verb
verb tenses.example: 今、勉強しています (Ima, benkyou shiteimasu) - I am studying now

verb tenses.name: た (ta)
verb tenses.explanation: Indicates the past tense of a verb
verb tenses.example: 昨日、友達に会いました (Kinou, tomodachi ni aimashita) - I met my friend yesterday

verb tenses.name: て (te)
verb tenses.explanation: Indicates the conjunctive form of a verb
verb tenses.example: 勉強して、テストを受けます (Benkyou shite, tesuto wo ukemasu) - I study and take a test

verb tenses.name: ない (nai)
verb tenses.explanation: Indicates the negative form of a verb
verb tenses.example: 行かない (Ikanai) - I don't go

verb tenses.name: たい (tai)
verb tenses.explanation: Indicates the desire to do something
verb tenses.example: 旅行したいです (Ryokou shitai desu) - I want to travel

verb tenses.name: よう (you)
verb tenses.explanation: Indicates the likelihood or potential of an action
verb tenses.example: 明日、雨が降るようです (Ashita, ame ga furu you desu) - It seems like it will rain tomorrow

sentence structures.name: の (no)
sentence structures.explanation: Indicates possession or the relationship between two nouns
sentence structures.example: 私の本 (Watashi no hon) - My book

sentence structures.name: こと (koto)
sentence structures.explanation: Indicates an action or event in a noun form
sentence structures.example: 日本語を勉強すること (Nihongo wo benkyou suru koto) - Studying Japanese

sentence structures.name: という (to iu)
sentence structures.explanation: Indicates a quotation or the name of something
sentence structures.example: 東京という町 (Toukyou to iu machi) - The city called Tokyo

sentence structures.name: が (ga)
sentence structures.explanation: Indicates the subject of a sentence or a noun that stands out
sentence structures.example: 犬が好きです (Inu ga suki desu) - I like dogs

sentence structures.name: に (ni)
sentence structures.explanation: Indicates the time, location, or indirect object of an action
sentence structures.example: 学校に行きます (Gakkou ni ikimasu) - I go to school

sentence structures.name: で (de)
sentence structures.explanation: Indicates the location or means of an action
sentence structures.example: 公園で遊びます (Kouen de asobimasu) - I play in the park

miscellaneous.name: のに (noni)
miscellaneous.explanation: Indicates a contrast between the expected and actual situation
miscellaneous.example: 勉強したのに、テストで失敗しました (Benkyou shita noni, tesuto de shippai shimashita) - I studied, but failed the test

miscellaneous.name: ば (ba)
miscellaneous.example: 早く起きれば、朝ごはんを食べます (Hayaku okireba, asagohan wo tabemasu) - If I wake up early, I eat breakfast

miscellaneous.name: なら (nara)
miscellaneous.explanation: Indicates a hypothetical situation or a suggestion
miscellaneous.example: もし時間があるなら、映画を見に行きましょう (Moshi jikan ga aru nara, eiga wo mi ni ikimashou) - If we have time, let's go see a movie
